name: Basic British Scones
author: Angela Martini
summary: After much trial and error, I've come up with this basic scone recipe which rivals the scones at Tea & Sympathy in NYC.
directions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
Sift the flour, cream of tartar, baking soda and salt into a bowl
Rub in the butter until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs
Stir in the sugar and enough milk to mix to a soft dough
Turn onto a floured surface, knead lightly and roll out to a 3/4-inch thickness
Cut into 2-inch rounds and place on the prepared baking sheet
Bake at 425 degrees F (220 degrees C) for 10 minutes then cool on a wire rack
Serve with butter or clotted cream and jam
